text: Ethylbenzene is a chemical compound made of carbon and hydrogen (a hydrocarbon). It has the chemical formula or . Ethylbenzene is a structural isomer of xylene, meaning they both have the formula , so the second formula (which shows the ethyl group) is used to specifically talk about ethylbenzene. == Uses == Removing two hydrogen atoms from the ethyl group (the part of the molecule that sticks out from the ring) changes ethylbenzene into styrene, an important chemical used to make rubber. ==References== Category:Aromatic compounds Category:Hydrocarbons
title: Ethylbenzene
